resources.string: The game consists of clearing all the squares on the screen that do not hide a *krabby patty*. Some squares have a number, this number indicates the *krabby patties* that are in all the surrounding squares. Thus, if a square has the number 3, it means that of the eight squares around it (if it is not in a corner or edge) there are 3 with *crabburger* and 5 without *crabburger*. If a square without a number is discovered, it indicates that none of the neighboring squares have *krabby patties* and these are automatically discovered. If a square with a mine is discovered, the game is *krabby patty*. You can put a mark on the squares that the player thinks are *crabby patties* to help figure out which ones are nearby.
